page.title: 20Smarden Religion & Charities
page.content: The General Baptists meet in the Zion Chapel, a building in the classical style, dating from 1841. At present regular worshippers number about 12. Attached to the chapel is a schoolroom for meetings of groups such as the Women's Fellowship. A commune was founded on Buddhist principles in 1977 at Gilletts and has 12 adults & some child members at present. 2 charities founded centuries ago still benefit local people. Jacob Turner left property to clothe poor children; interest on the investment is now given to the poor at Christmas. The Dadson Trust is an educational charity providing grants for apprentices & students in further education. 2 groups also raise money in memory of two little girls who died here in recent years.
